result.execSummary:
The defendant Jodi L. Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Order/Judgment Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations, for Restitution and for Court Ordered Financial Obligations.
The Court Finds, Orders and Adjudges: The defendant's probation is extended for 2 years from 7-15-2021 to 7-15-2023; or until all court obligations are completed, whichever comes first. This extension will serve the purposes for which probation was imposed. Restitution and Court costs.
